title: No type mapping for org.hibernate.type.SqlTypes code: 1111 (OTHER)
body:
### Describe the bug

In our code we use postgres enum types. For the java type we use the "PostgreSQLEnumType" from the "hypersistence-utils" (former hibernate-types).
After upgrading to quarkus 3.0.1 the application doesn't start anymore due to the error
`No type mapping for org.hibernate.type.SqlTypes code: 1111 (OTHER)`

Actually I'm not sure if this is a quarkus related problem or a hypersistence-utils issue, or if i'm just missing to add something new in hibernate 6.2

### Expected behavior

The code should work with the `PostgreSQLEnumType` as it worked with quarkus 2.x (of course with the adjustments for hibernate 6.2)

### Actual behavior

We have following fields on the entity:

```java
@Enumerated(EnumType.STRING)
@Type(PostgreSQLEnumType.class)
@Column(name = "event_type")
private EventType eventType;
```

When starting the application we get following error:


### How to Reproduce?

1. Create a project with dependency to `io.hypersistence:hypersistence-utils-hibernate-62:3.3.2`
2. Add an entity with a field:
```java
@Enumerated(EnumType.STRING)
@Type(PostgreSQLEnumType.class)
@Column(name = "event_type")
private EventType eventType;
```
3. Start the application

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

Java 17

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

3.0.1.Final

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

gradlew 8.1.1

### Additional information

_No response_
